text:
*Use Membership for Service*

_Use Case : I create a ticket form submission. When people submit the form I give to people access to a membership page where I want to list all tickets they submitted._

I don’t succeed to get lists of tickets from a logged user. With *crm_objects* I can get all tickets but not specific to this contact

Any idea ?
you could use associations to the contact <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/functions#crm-associations>

Difficult no ?
We have more than 100 tickets created but I can’t get all and for each make a crm_association() because we’re limited to 10 times in a page ...
you would make 1 call for all the tickets associated to the contact.
For a contact Who is logged I want to get all associated tickets
I think <@U25C65C3S> did something like this?
you could do that based on their contact cookied ID
We've got all open tickets by company set up and it's using 3 loops.

Don’t confuse crm_objects and crm_object. 

You can list out all the tickets with crm_objects, and then link up detail view with crm_object
